replies.body: Shouldn't the Title more Correctly read Ability Downgrade: Azir?

I like the rework, but changing his ultimate might be a bit too much. blocking enemy dashes is the fun part, watching them burn their escapes trying to get over the wall whilst you poke them down with your soldiers single-handedly- that is satisfying. I think you should have reduced the duration of the ultimate instead of allowing dashes to work after the push.

That's the point though. That level of zoning is insane you can't get onto him. You can't get away because you will just get chased down with soldiers and the dash mechanic.{{champion:268}} wasn't even close to balanced and the fact that these changes make him both fair and basically unplayable is why the whole concept of {{champion:268}} should be rethought IMO. Adjustments could make him really good in the right hands.

Hey Riot, why didn't you just change Azir's ultimate to simply disappear after the complete travel time of his soldiers have been reached?
I don't really see the point of having the soldiers stay in place for another 3 seconds when they are now effectively useless as functioning as a barricade against the enemy champions.
And since they function as normal terrain, wouldn't it just be less confusing if they weren't there anymore after the initial travel time?

I think his ult still kind of works as a wall, since there are some champions (like Yasuo) which need some sort of thing to use their dash, and if they don't have that Azir can stay safely behind his wall. I don't enjoy the changes to azir, but they're livable
Yes please! make the wall dissolve....it's been unpassable for so long and not everyone reads this stuff. Just do it...its better that way

Reducing a characters attack range in a phenomenal nerf, and there really don't seem to be any significant new options granted to him, maybe something like some bonus speed if he hits an enemy with q would've helped him keep his distance from his enemies.

I like the rework, but changing his ultimate might be a bit too much. blocking enemy dashes is the fun part, watching them burn their escapes trying to get over the wall whilst you poke them down with your soldiers single-handedly- that is satisfying. I think you should have reduced the duration of the ultimate instead of allowing dashes to work after the push.
